If you're looking for a war story with epic scope and a compelling plot, then "The Expendables 2" might be your cup of tea. Its thrilling action and unexpected twists will keep you on the edge of your seat.

If you prefer a more nuanced and thought-provoking film, then "Man on Wire" might be your choice. Its daring and beautifully shot cinematography will take you on a visual journey through the extraordinary life of a talented wire walker.

If you're interested in a historical drama about a pivotal moment in American history, then "Lincoln" is a must-see. Its powerful performances and historical accuracy will leave you deeply moved by the plight of the slaves during the Civil War.

Another film that might be more suitable for a lighter-hearted but thought-provoking experience is "Saving Private Ryan" (1998). The film follows a group of soldiers on their perilous journey behind enemy lines during World War II.

If you're interested in a thriller with a more psychological tone, then "Taken" (2008) starring Liam Neeson and Donnie Wahlberg might be worth your time. The film follows a group of friends who are held captive by a dangerous gang of kidnappers.
